properties.areaDesc: Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 1:41PM PST until January 12 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 3000 feet. Total snow
accumulations of 15 to 20 inches, with locally higher amounts
possible. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...The Cascade foothills above 3000 feet in eastern
Jackson and Douglas Counties, including Dead Indian Memorial
Road, Tiller- Trail Highway, and Highway 62 north of Prospect.

* WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 10 PM PST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Gusty
winds could cause periods of low visibility due to blowing and
drifting snow.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions.

* If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets,
food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you.

* The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

* A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is
imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take
protective action now.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET
